org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors
Class AeWSBPELDefVariableUsageVisitor

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors.AeAbstractDefVisitor
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors.AeDefVariableUsageVisitor
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors.AeWSBPELDefVariableUsageVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeDefVisitor
public class AeWSBPELDefVariableUsageVisitor
extends AeDefVariableUsageVisitor

Def visitor that records resources that need to be locked for WS-BPEL 2.0 rules. Note that the visitor that assigns To Strategies to the ToDef must be run before this visitor runs.

mIsolatedCompensationHandlerScope

private AeActivityScopeDef mIsolatedCompensationHandlerScope
The scope that owns the compensation handler for the current isolation domain or null if we are not traversing an isolated domain for a compensation handler.

getPathForPartnerLink

private java.lang.String getPathForPartnerLink(AeActivityDef aDef,
                                               java.lang.String aPartnerLinkName)
Walks up the stack looking for an AeScopeDef that defines the partner link passed in. We should ALWAYS find one or we have a bad bpel file.

Parameters:
aPartnerLinkName -

addPartnerLinkLock

protected void addPartnerLinkLock(AeActivityDef aDef,
                                  java.lang.String aPartnerLinkName,
                                  AeDefVariableUsageVisitor.AeLockType aLockType)
We'll record the usage of the partner link based on the lock type and whether or not the activity is nested within a serializable scope. In all cases, we record a lock if it's a write lock. This is because the rules for a serializable scope say that a variable should not change once the scope is entered. If an activity outside of the serializable scope wants to write to a partner link then it must obtain a write lock and as such, we're recording that requirement here. If we're in a serializable scope however, we acquire a lock irrespective of the lock flag since the serializable scope acquires locks on all of the partner links its using to prevent another serializable scope from accessing these same partner links until the locks are released. This prevents the issue of dirty reads and non-repeatable reads.

Parameters:
aDef - - the def that uses the variable
aPartnerLinkName - - the name of the partner link
aLockType - - true if we're adding a write lock

getResourcesUsedSet

protected java.util.Set getResourcesUsedSet(AeActivityDef aActivityDef)
Overrides method to return the resources used by the compensation handler for the current isolation domain if we are traversing an isolated domain for a compensation handler. Otherwise, returns the resources used by the given activity.

Overrides:
getResourcesUsedSet in class AeDefVariableUsageVisitor
Parameters:
aActivityDef -
See Also:
AeDefVariableUsageVisitor.getResourcesUsedSet(org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.AeActivityDef)

getTargetForLock

protected AeActivityDef getTargetForLock(AeActivityDef aDef)
Overrides method to return the scope that owns the compensation handler of the current isolation domain if we are traversing the isolation domain for a compensation handler. In WS-BPEL, the compensation handler of an isolated scope forms an isolation domain separate from the isolation domain of the rest of the scope.

Overrides:
getTargetForLock in class AeDefVariableUsageVisitor
Parameters:
aDef -
See Also:
AeDefVariableUsageVisitor.getTargetForLock(org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.AeActivityDef)
